org.lemming.utils

Class LevMarBev

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lemming.utils.LevMarBev
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class LevMarBev
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

    Program to do a least-squares fit to a non-linear function with a linearization of the fitting function. This gradient-expansion algorithm (a.k.a Levenberg-Marquardt method) is taken from the book Data Reduction and Error Analysis for Physical Sciences, by P.R. Bevington

    Allows for
    • each function parameter to be fixed/floated independently
    • specifying a weight for each data point

    The original FORTRAN version of this code was written by EAH

    pFloat - specifies which parameters in p are allowed to vary (float) or are fixed during the fitting process, 0=fixed or 1=float. For example, if there are 4 parameters in the function and pFloat=[1,1,0,1] then parameters 0, 1 and 3 are allowed to vary (float) while parameter 2 is fixed at the value specified in p[2] - specifies which parameters in p are allowed to vary (float) or are fixed during the fitting process, 0=fixed or 1=float. For example, if there are 4 parameters in the function and pFloat=[1,1,0,1] then parameters 0, 1 and 3 are allowed to vary (float) while parameter 2 is fixed at the value specified in p[2]

    xmin, xmax (for 1D) or double[] xxmin, xxmax (for nD) - if these values are specified then the function is evaluated using the best-fit parameters for each value in fitX and the function-evaluated values are stored within the double[] fitY variable. For nD data, the values would be xxmin=[xmin1, ..., xminN] and xxmax=[xmax1, ..., xmaxN]

    This class also produces the following variables

    • double[] pBest - the parameters that best fit the data to minimize the chi square
    • double[] dpBest - the uncertainty for each parameter, if the parameter was fixed in the fit then its uncertainty will be 0.0
    • double[][] der - a p.length by y.length array containing the values of the partial derivatives

    This class may also produce the following variables if requested for in the constructor

    • double[] fitX (for 1D) or double[][] fitXX (for nD) - for 1D data - values from xmin to xmax (inclusive) using nStep steps for nD data - values from xmin=[xmin1, ..., xminN] to xmax=[xmax1, ..., xmaxN] (inclusive) using nStep steps
    • double[] fitY - for each value in fitX the corresponding function-evaluated values are calculated using the best-fit parameters
    • double[] currentY - the function evaluated at each x value using the latest best-fit parameters
    • double[] residuals - the values of the residuals (y - currentY)
    Author:
    Joe Borbely

    • Constructor Detail

      • LevMarBev

        public LevMarBev(FitFunction function,
                 double[][] x,
                 double[] y,
                 double[] p,
                 byte[] pFloat,
                 double[] dy,
                 int maxIter,
                 double precision,
                 double[] xmin,
                 double[] xmax,
                 int nSteps,
                 boolean calcRes,
                 boolean verbose)
        see LevMarBev
        Parameters:
        function - - the fitting function to use
        x - - the x values
        y - - the y values (the dependent variable)
        p - - the initial guess
        pFloat - - specifies which parameters in p are allowed to vary (float) or are fixed during the fitting process, 0=fixed or 1=float. For example, if there are 4 parameters in the function and pFloat=[1,1,0,1] then parameters 0, 1 and 3 are allowed to vary (float) while parameter 2 is fixed at the value specified in p[2]
        dy - - the uncertainty for each value in y, used as the weights (1/dy)^2
        maxIter - - the maximum number of fitting iterations that are allowed
        p - - the initial guessrecision
        x - - the x valuesmin
        x - - the x valuesmax
        precision - - keep iterating the fit until this relative precision is reached
        xmin - - xmin=[xmin1, ..., xminN]
        xmax - - xmax=[xmax1, ..., xmaxN]
        nSteps - - the number of evenly-spaced numbers to use to generate the double[] fitX variable (i.e., fitX goes from xmin to xmax (inclusive) using nSteps steps)
        calcRes - - specify whether to calculate residuals
        verbose - - specify whether to display warning messages.

For example, if there are 4 parameters in the function and pFloat=[1,1,0,1] then parameters 0, 1 and 3 are allowed to vary (float) while parameter 2 is fixed at the value specified in p[2]
        dy - - the uncertainty for each value in y, used as the weights (1/dy)^2

        precision - - keep iterating the fit until this relative precision is reached
        xmin - - xmin=[xmin1, ..., xminN]
        xmax - - xmax=[xmax1, ..., xmaxN]
        nSteps - - the number of evenly-spaced numbers to use to generate the double[] fitX variable (i.e., fitX goes from xmin to xmax (inclusive) using nSteps steps)
        calcRes - - specify whether to calculate residuals.
        verbose - - specify whether to display warning messages.
